alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Gibson; Henderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll, Gibson and Henderson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 450 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Humboldt, Milan, Huntingdon, Bruceton, Atwood, Parkers Crossroads, Wildersville, Vale, Bargerton, Blue Goose, Medina, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, Gibson, Clarksburg, McLemoresville, Hillard, Palmer Shelter, Westport and Tate. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
